comment.author: 35851068@N00
comment._content: I'm curious about the Eiffel Tower in the window. Would it have been a model for a child to build, or something else? Anyone know?

comment.author: 61849735@N00
comment._content: I bet it was to show what you could build with an Erector set.  My brothers had one in the '50's.  sort of the first version of leggos I suppose!

comment.author: 73086272@N04
comment._content: I wish I had one just like it

comment.author: 35851068@N00
comment._content: An Erector set hadn't even crossed my mind, but that makes sense. Thanks!

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Gilbert patented the Erector Set in 1913.  Meccano had been patented by Hornby in England in 1901.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: www.meccanopedia.com/wiki/index.php?title=Eiffel_Tower_By... shows a somewhat similar (but not identical) Meccano Eiffel Tower. www.meccanopedia.com/wiki/index.php?title=File:Manual_2_t... is from a 1925 Meccano manual and looks even more like the model in the window here.
